lines: Just below the rectangle they had painted a red belt.
Mango was furious, then filled with shame. He began to cry.
"What's this? Why did they paint this on me? Why did they put a number on me? And why this red belt? Why were they so cruel? Why? Oh why?"
He looked around and saw that all the trees had rectangles, red belts and were numbered.
He asked one of them, "What's the meaning of this? Did anyone ask your permission before doing this to you?"
The Arjuna replied, "Thank your lucky stars, silly! You have become government property. Nobody will bother you now. The Government looks after us."
"No, no, go away! I don't belong to anyone!"
He saw sparkling water at the foot of the hill. It seemed to beckon to him, "Come quickly."
He headed towards the river to drink his fill and wash of the badge of bondage when...
He was often called Mad. Why listen to fools. I must go my own way.
He reached the river just as the sun was setting. The river's ripples were orange-red, like kumkum, reflecting the western sky. He remembered the farmer's wife saying "Son, don't go, stay with us."
Mango closed his eyes for a moment drinking in the sight of the flowing water.
